moves.1. c4: i like english as white or black
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 g6 3. Nf3 d6 4. d4 Bg7 5: black is ready to the expanse on king-side.
moves.6. Be2 Nbd7 7. O-O: white is ready to attack on the queen side.
moves.7... Re8 8. e4 e5 9. dxe5 Nxe5 10. Nxe5: I am not that good with the theory, but i have the impression that this move is giving the advantage to black.
moves.10... Rxe5 11. f4 Re8 12. Bf3 Nd7 13. Be: well, I never miss that kind of occasion.
moves.13... Bxc3 14. bxc3: black has now a well-structured pawn structure. White has a queen-side in a pity condition. At last, there has been no king-side attack from black  neither queen-side attack from white, but this is all because white has chosen this atypical middle-game.
moves.15. Qc2 Bg4: finishing the opening after the middle-game has started.
moves.16. e5 Bxf3 17. Rxf3 Ng4 18. Rd1: threatening clearly to destroy my pawns structure... If you can, try to guess my next move, i have been thinking quite a lot on it.
moves.19... Nxe3: and this is why g3 was not really indicated.
moves.20. Rxe3 Qg4: now, exd is forbidden of course...
moves.21. Rde1 Rad8: and now my structure remains intact.
moves.22. exd6 Rxe3 23. Rxe3 Rxd6: black is really better, thought there is no material advantage.
moves.29. Kf3 Rxh2: better this one, of course, where the white structure is better. Now black has the possibility to save a bad pawn or to take a good one.
moves.37. Rxa5: and finally, the g and h pawns will be the decisive ones...
moves.37... Rb3: to avoid the advancing of c-pawn. Rb5 would not resolve, because h-pawn will arrive before an aventual white pawn on queen-side
moves.38. Kd5 h5 39. c5: it is not as scary as it looks.
moves.41... Kf6: hehe... finally his majesty is in... I was waiting for the good occasion
moves.44... Kg4 45. Kd6 Kg3: the king pushes the defender. Rooks are bad defenders, actually, when they are confronted to pawn and king.
moves.47. Re1 g5 48. f5: probably the best move, but this allows me to pushes g-pawn further.
moves.50. Rc2+ Kg3 51. Rc1 Kf4: the rooks is blocked on line 1, so the king can go back on f-column, gaining a tempo by threatening the pawn, forcing white to play...
moves.52... g4: and this is definitive... there is nothing more that can save white now, unless i give up... Actually, as white, I would have resgined much sooner.
that's all folks. Tomorrow, I will comment a lost game, for a change... I have a lot of them too, but usually my lost games are a real mess... I recently lost a game against mandrake that is a beauty from him. I'll try to show you.
